intro: Dalechampia brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stemmed dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing characteristics. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
